comment: An open set is a subset of a metric space which includes a ball around each of its points. Definition 1.3-2 of [Kreyszig] p. 18. The object ` ( MetOpen `` D ) ` is the family of all open sets in the metric space determined by the metric ` D ` . By ~ mopntop , the open sets of a metric space form a topology ` J ` , whose base set is ` U. J ` by ~ mopnuni . (Contributed by NM, 1-Sep-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Nov-2013.)
